IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: DEDICATED TO THE PRESERVATION AND RESTORATION OF SIGHT; TO DILIGENTLY SERVING THE PEOPLE IN OUR AREA FIRST, THAN AIDING THOSE IN OTHER STATES AND COUNTRIES; TO FINDING THE CAUSES AND CURES OF BLINDING EYE DISEASES THROUGH SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH; TO PRESERVING SIGHT THROUGH EYE CARE PROGRAMS, AND MAKING SIGHT RESTORATION POSSIBLE THROUGH EYE BANKING.
IRS990.MissionDescription: DEDICATED TO THE PRESERVATION AND RESTORATION OF SIGHT; TO DILIGENTLY SERVING THE PEOPLE IN OUR AREA FIRST, THAN AIDING THOSE IN OTHER STATES AND COUNTRIES; TO FINDING THE CAUSES AND CURES OF BLINDING EYE DISEASES THROUGH SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH; TO PRESERVING SIGHT THROUGH EYE CARE PROGRAMS, AND MAKING SIGHT RESTORATION POSSIBLE THROUGH EYE BANKING.
IRS990.Description: HEARTLAND LIONS EYE BANKS: THE MAIN PURPOSE OF HEARTLAND LIONS EYE BANKS (HLEB) IS TO RECOVER, EVALUATE AND DISTRIBUTE THE HIGHEST QUALITY DONOR EYE TISSUE TO CORNEAL SURGEONS AND VISION RESEARCHERS. CURRENTLY, THE HLEB ARE COMPOSED OF SEVEN BRANCHES IN THREE STATES WITH OFFICES IN COLUMBIA, MO; SPRINGFIELD, MO; ST. LOUIS, MO; KANSAS CITY, MO; SPRINGFIELD, IL; HAYS, KS; AND JOPLIN, MO. ALL OF THESE BRANCHES ARE OWNED AND OPERATED BY THE MISSOURI LIONS EYE RESEARCH FOUNDATION. (CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O) HLEB SYSTEM IS ONE OF THE LARGEST EYE BANKS IN NORTH AMERICA IN TERMS OF SERVICE AREA. THE EYE BANK IS ALSO A MEMBER OF VISION SHARE, A CONSORTIUM OF US EYE BANKS ACCREDITED BY THE EYE BANK ASSOCIATION OF AMERICA (EBAA). THROUGH ITS MEMBERSHIP IN VISION SHARE, HLEB IS ABLE TO DISTRIBUTE ADDITIONAL TISSUE THROUGH THE ORGANIZATION'S TISSUE DISTRIBUTION SERVICES. HLEB IS ALSO ONE OF THE LARGEST EYE BANKS IN NORTH AMERICA IN TERMS OF PROVIDING CORNEAS FOR TRANSPLANT. DURING THE 2008 CALENDAR YEAR, HLEB RANKED THE 5TH HIGHEST IN TRANSPLANTS OF ALL EBAA ACCREDITED EYE BANKS. HLEB FOCUS ON HELPING THE PEOPLE OF MISSOURI, ILLINOIS AND KANSAS. CORNEAS ARE 1ST MADE AVAILABLE TO PATIENTS IN NEED OF A TRANSPLANT IN THESE 3 STATES. WHEN ALL REQUESTS FOR CORNEAL TISSUE IN THIS PRIMARY SERVICE AREA HAVE BEEN FILLED, REMAINING EYE TISSUE IS OFFERED TO SURGEONS IN OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED STATES. IF THERE IS NO IMMEDIATE NEED IN THIS COUNTRY, CORNEAS CAN BE OFFERED TO SURGEONS AND PATIENTS IN OTHER NATIONS. THIS SYSTEM ALLOWS US TO FULFILL 100% OF THE REQUESTS WE RECEIVE FOR PATIENTS IN MISSOURI, ILLINOIS AND KANSAS. IT ALSO ALLOWS THE EYE BANK TO HELP PEOPLE THROUGHOUT THE REST OF THE UNITED STATES AND ALL OVER THE WORLD. HLEB SUPPLY EYE TISSUE FOR RESEARCH OR TEACHING TO SCIENTISTS AT UNIVERSITIES AS WELL AS TO THE NATIONAL EYE INSTITUTES IN BETHESDA, MARYLAND. THE EYE BANK ALSO PROVIDES TISSUE TO THE NATIONAL DISEASE RESEARCH INTERCHANGE, A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT PROVIDES BIOMEDICAL RESEARCHERS REGULAR ACCESS TO HUMAN TISSUES AND ORGANS. IT IS ILLEGAL AND UNETHICAL TO CHARGE A FEE FOR ANY HUMAN ORGAN AND TISSUES. THE EYE BANKS' PROCESSING FEE HELPS TO COVER EXPENSES INCURRED IN PREPARING AND PROVIDING THE HIGHEST QUALITY OF EYE TISSUE POSSIBLE TO THE PATIENT. SAFETY MUST BE ENSURED DURING A THOROUGH REVIEW OF THE DONOR'S MEDICAL HISTORY, MICROSCOPIC EVALUATIONS OF THE DONATED EYE TISSUE, DONOR FAMILY INTERVIEWS AND LABORATORY TESTING. THERE IS NEVER ANY FEE CHARGED TO THE DONOR FAMILY. THE PROCESSING FEE IS ONLY CHARGED WHEN A PATIENT HAS THIRD-PARTY COVERAGE. IF A PATIENT DOES NOT HAVE INSURANCE, THE PROCESSING FEE CAN BE WAIVED. THE FOUNDATION'S EYE CARE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM PROVIDES GRATIS CORNEAL TISSUE TO INDIGENT RECIPIENTS WHO DO NOT HAVE THIRD-PARTY COVERAGE.

Activity2.Description: AMBLYOPIA SCREENING PROGRAM: IN 1994, IN COLLABORATION WITH CHILDREN'S HOSPITAL IN ST. LOUIS, THE FOUNDATION STARTED OFFERING SCREENINGS TO PRESCHOOLS AND DAY CARE CENTERS STATE-WIDE, AND TO DATE, HAS SCREENED THE EYES OF MORE THAN 100,000 CHILDREN. THE FOUNDATION CURRENTLY OFFERS TWO NON-INVASIVE SCREENING METHODS, EACH ONE PERFORMED BY TRAINED AMBLYOPIA SCREENERS - FILM BASED SCREEN AND PLUSOPTIX. ALL PARENTS OF CHILDREN SCREENED BY THE FOUNDATION ARE NOTIFIED OF THE RESULTS. IF A CHILD SHOWS SYMPTOMS OF VISUAL ABNORMALITIES, THE PARENT IS STRONGLY ENCOURAGED (CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O) TO TAKE HIM OR HER TO AN EYE DOCTOR FOR A FULL EXAMINATION.

Activity3.Description: GLAUCOMA DETECTION AND OTHER EYE CARE ASSISTANCE: THE FOUNDATION HELPS DETECT SYMPTOMS OF GLAUCOMA IN MISSOURIANS THROUGH OUR MOBILE GLAUCOMA DETECTION PROGRAM. THE PROGRAM SCREENS INDIVIDUALS BY USING A NON-CONTACT TONOMETER THAT DETERMINES PRESSURE WITHIN THE EYE. THOSE WHO EXHIBIT SYMPTOMS ARE ENCOURAGED TO VISIT AN EYE CARE PROFESSIONAL FOR FURTHER TESTING. GALUCOMA SCREENING IS FREE TO THE PUBLIC, BUT SPONSORING CLUBS OR BUSINESSES ARE ASKED TO DONATE A MINIMUM OF 100 PER DAY OF SCREENING TO COVER SOME OF THE EXPENSES(CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O) INCURRED BY THE FOUNDATION. AN AVERAGE GLAUCOMA SCREENING COSTS THE FOUNDATION 900 FOR EQUIPMENT MAINTENANCE, STAFF TIME AND TRAVEL EXPENSES. THE 100 DONATION HELPS KEEP THE GLAUCOMA DETECTION PROGRAM ON THE ROAD IN MISSOURI. EYE CARE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM: THE FOUNDATION BEGAN WORKING WITH EYE CARE FACILITIES THROUGHOUT MISSOURI IN 1994 TO INCREASE THE AVAILABILITY OF EYE CARE TO INDIGENT PEOPLE. THE EYE CARE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO HELP INDIVIDUALS SUFFERING FROM EYE DISEASE OR INJURY. THE FOUNDATION NEGOTIATES FEE SCHEDULES WITH EYE CARE FACILITIES THROUGHOUT MISSOURI TO PAY A REDUCED FEE FOR THE TREATMENT OF EYE CARE ASSISTANCE PATIENTS. EVERY EFFORT IS MADE TO ALLOW THE PATIENT TO CHOOSE THEIR OWN DOCTOR OR A DOCTOR CLOSE TO THEIR HOME FOR TREATMENT. THIS WAY, PATIENTS DO NOT HAVE TO TRAVEL TO RECEIVE TREATMENT FOR THEIR VISION CONDITIONS. THE EYE CARE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM HAS PROVIDED THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE NEEDED FOR DIAGNOSTIC TESTING, TREATMENT, AND SOMETIMES SURGERY FOR PATIENTS IN EACH OF THE LION DISTRICTS. IN ADDITION, THE ECA PROGRAM HAS PROVIDED GRATIS CORNEAL TISSUE FOR NUMEROUS MISSOURIANS. IF THE FOUNDATION IS UNABLE TO ASSIST THE PATIENT WITH ALL OF THEIR ASSISTANCE NEEDS WE WILL WORK WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS TO GET THE PATIENT WELL-ROUNDED COVERAGE. ALL APPLICANTS MUST MEET CERTAIN CRITERIA TO ENROLL IN THE PROGRAM. EYEGLASS RECYCLING: THE FOUNDATION SERVES AS THE MISSOURI LIONS' OFFICIAL COLLECTION SITE FOR USED EYEGLASSES. LION VOLUNTEERS AND FOUNDATION PERSONNEL SORT EYEGLASSES THAT COME FROM ALL OVER THE STATE. EACH PAIR OF GLASSES IS CLEANED AND ANALYZED FOR ITS LEVEL OF CORRECTION BY PHILANTHROPIC GROUPS. APPROXIMATELY 60,000 PAIRS OF EYEGLASSES ARE DONATED ANNUALLY TO THE FOUNDATION. ALL OF THE USABLE EYEGLASSES GO TO HELP THE NEEDY IN DEVELOPING COUNTRIES. SINCE JULY 1989, OVER ONE MILLION PAIRS OF RECYCLED GLASSES HAVE BEEN SENT OVERSEAS.

ActivityOther.Description: EDUCATION, SIGHT COMMITTEE, INDIGENT PATIENT CARE

EDUCATION, SIGHT COMMITTEE, INDIGENT PATIENT CARE
BRANCHES MUST FOLLOW POLICIES AND PROCEDURES DEVELOPED BY THE FOUNDATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS USED TO REVIEW FORM 990
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE 990 DRAFT .PDF FILE IS RECEIVED FROM THE AUDITOR. THE FILE IS SENT TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND HE EMAILS THE FILE TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW. DURING THE NEXT BOARD OF DIRECTORS MEETING, THE 990 FORM IS ADDED TO THE AGENDA TO DISCUSS AND QUESTIONS AND DISCUSSION IS DOCUMENTED IN THE BOARD MINUTES.
BOARD MINUTES MUST OUTLINE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND WILL BE PART OF THE OFFICIAL RECORD. THIS WILL BE REVIEWED ANNUALLY AT THE JUNE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MEETING.

SALARY AND/OR INCENTIVE AWARD INCREASES FOR PERFORMANCE WILL BE ROUTINELY REVIEWED FOR ADJUSTMENT PRIOR TO JULY 1ST OF EACH YEAR. THE CURRENT EVALUATION AND RATING SYSTEMS IN PRACTICE WILL APPLY. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR HAS THE AUTHORITY TO MAKE ADJUSTMENTS DURING OTHER PERIODS OF THE YEAR AS NEEDED.
ANNUAL REVIEW PER CHIEF COMPLIANCE OFFICER. RECOMMENDATION FOR ANNUAL INCREASE IS APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.
GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
